title: Bartender
description:
**YOUR NEXT OPPORTUNITY IS NOW BOARDING:**  Join OTG as a Bartender now and drive a new type of hospitality. Explore career opportunities in a unique hospitality environment with some of the industry's best compensation and benefits, including PTO, Healthcare, and a competitive 401k match.
  
  

WHAT IS OTG? OTG has revolutionized the hospitality industry by pushing the boundaries of excellence. With more than 300 in-terminal dining and retail locations across 10 airports, OTG and its 5,000+ Crewmembers serve millions of travelers each year.
  
  

WHY OTG? By joining our team, you’ll discover endless opportunities to explore, learn and realize your greatest potential in some of the most exciting hospitality environments around. Our people drive our experiences, so we offer our crewmembers some of the best compensation and benefits in the industry. OTG has introduced Dayforce Wallet, which allows Crewmembers to make everyday payday by using the pay they’ve already earned to cover expenses before their next paycheck.
  
  

We transform airport experiences. You drive it.
  
  

Pay Rate $10.65 Plus Tips
  
  

**Position Summary:**  

Bartenders are responsible for delivering the OTG guest experience. Educating, making recommendations based on guest preferences, taking orders, up-selling special items, and maintaining a clean and sanitized area are steps to deliver the experience. To be successful in this role, a bartender should enjoy working with others as exhibited through great guest experiences and be motivated to keep the area/restaurant cleaned and stocked.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Greet guests quickly and pleasantly, with a smile
  
  

Educate guests on menu items; make recommendations to guests upon request
  
  

Pour beer & wine
  
  

Assist guests in entering all orders into the iPad/computer system
  
  

Mix ingredients for all drinks, including cocktails, to OTG specifications
  
  

Follow OTG cash handling and cash register policies and procedures
  
  

Keep a spotless working environment through regular cleaning and sanitizing
  
  

Aid in moving and installing kegs of beer, CO2 tanks, and soda mixes
  
  

Assist in the training and development of new employees
  
  

Monitor and report intoxicated guests to MOD
  
  

Communicate any product runouts, equipment issues, or quality of service problems to the MOD immediately
  
  

Other duties as assigned.
  
  

QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS
  
  

Must have extensive bartending skills, including cocktails and specialty drinks, plus strong product knowledge
  
  

Must be at least 18 years of age
  
  

Must have pairing knowledge of beers and wines
  
  

Must become TIPS certified within 90 days of employment
  
  

Must obtain SERVSafe Certification or equivalent within 30 days of being hired
  
  

Must be experienced and able to serve and prepare food
  
  

Fully conversational in English
  
  

Able to lift 35 lbs. in weight
  
  

Must be mobile and able to stand for extended periods, to stoop, kneel, and crouch
  
  

Must be available to work varied hours/days, including nights, weekends, holidays, and bad weather conditions--must be flexible
  
  

OTG Management LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Customer Service Representative - UniFirst
description:
UniFirst is seeking a dedicated Customer Service Representative to join our team. You will be a key player in delivering outstanding customer service as a liaison between customers and the company. At UniFirst we have a 5-day work week, enjoy Saturday and Sunday off!! We have an immediate opening and provide on the job training.
  
  

**What you’ll be doing:**  

Assist customers by answering questions related to accounts, procedures, and services by telephone or email .
  
Provide excellent customer service to both customers and UniFirst personnel.
  
**Perform accounts receivable duties :** calling on outstanding accounts, processing credits and exchanges , and resolving account conflicts through UniFirst’s escalation process.
  
Partner and provide administrative support to UniFirst’s Sales Department.
  
Perform basic data entry and other administrative duties .
  
Qualifications
  
  

**What we’re looking for:**  

2 years of Customer Service experience in an administrative setting is preferred .
  
Prior Accounts Receivable experience is highly encouraged .
  
High School diploma or GED equivalent is recommended .
  
**Verbal & w ritten c ommunication skills:** professional telephone and email etiquette .
  
**E ssential skills :** active listener, responsive , and personable .
  
**Computer skills:** proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office products ( i.e. Outlook, Excel, Word, TEAMS, etc )
  
Time management and organizational skills with attention to detail.
  
A collaborative, team-player capable of working independently .
  
Problem solve r in a dynamic environment .
  
Comfortable performing basic mathematical skills ( i.e. adding, subtracting, multiplying, dividing, etc.)
  
  

What’s in it for you?
  
**Training :** We emphasize continuous learning and professional development, fostering a culture of growth and enabling team partners to reach their full potential. You'll receive on-the-job training, robust online training modules through our Service Certificate Program – Customer Service Representative, and access to UniFirst's innovative training platform, The Learning Center.
  
**Career Mobility:** We’re a growing company offering significant avenues for personal development and growth. Some companies like to promote from within, we love to!
  
**Community Culture:** Our unique community culture is what makes UniFirst an organization that stands out from the rest.
  
**Diversity:** At UniFirst, you'll find an environment packed with different cultures , personalities, and backgrounds because we know it takes many kinds of people to make us successful.
  
  

**Pay & Benefits:**  

On the job training + 401K with Company Match, Profit Sharing, Health Insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Direct Payroll Deposit, Tuition Reimbursement, 30% Employee Discount, Employee Referral Bonuses.
  
  

About UniFirst
  
The fabric of UniFirst is woven from its very unique family culture where our Team Partners enjoy a small company feel while taking advantage of the resources and stability that come with being a 2 billion-dollar organization.
  
  

UniFirst is an international leader in the $18 billion -dollar garment services industry. We currently employ over 14,000 team partners who serve 300,000 business customer locations throughout the U.S., Canada, and Europe. We were included in the top 10 of Selling Power magazine’s “Best Companies to Sell For” list and recognized on Forbes magazine’s “Platinum 400 – Best Big Companies” list. As an 80-year old company focused on annual growth, there’s never been a better time to join our team.
  
  

UniFirst is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or employment against any individual on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, ancestry, religion, physical or mental disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, or any other factor protected by anti-discrimination laws

title: Consumer Insights Analyst
description:
**ADP is hiring a Business Insights Analyst**. In this position you will collaborate with field leadership and other key stakeholders to identify areas of business improvements. Takes a targeted evaluation approach to document and deliver insights geared towards driving action and improvements at the associate, region and SBS level. Analyzes data for, reports on, and proposes solutions regarding trends impacting the overall client experience.


Utilizes effective communication skills to serve as liaisons between and among field and group staff in order to gather, document and analyze business requirements, participate in the development of project plans and execute completion of projects. Gains commitment, alignment and engagement in the business strategy. Provides the framework and strategy for a quality client experience.
  

Progression in the job family responsibilities include collaborating with Field Leadership and other stakeholders to identify business improvement needs. Ensuring timely, successful completion of projects by effectively managing relationships with regions and SBS senior leadership. Providing continual communication and coordination of functional activities with leadership and other regional departments. Responsible for analyzing and identifying metrics that impact the field as well as making recommendations for improvements. Monitors key metrics to address improving one or more key areas.


At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP.


We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

  

* Uses targeted evaluation approach to provide insights that drive action and solve business improvement needs.
* Regularly evaluate and score assigned associates' client interactions (phone, email, and web chat), utilizing the appropriate technology (e.g., NICE), systems (e.g., IEX, CMS, Clarify) and targeted evaluation forms.
* Evaluate client interactions against Service Excellence (Quality 1st Service, NPS, etc.) service delivery standards and measurements.
* Assess and report observed strengths and opportunities. Document all required evaluations, related comments and necessary support data (e.g., the interaction) within the NICE call recording system or other applicable system.
* Analyze trends at the team level and regularly provide insights on observed trends and their business impact along with insights and recommendations regarding root causes of observed trends. Report on business insights and innovation recommendations gained through observation of associate and client interactions.
* Stays abreast of system and service features, changes, enhancements and new products.

**QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:**  

* 1 to 3 years' experience as a Client Service Representative or the equivalent in a call center environment.

**PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS:**  



* Experience in Tableau or Power BI
* Background in analyzing Consumer Insights
* Analytical Insights

A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job.


YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:


* Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
* Belong by joining one of our Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.
* Grow your career in an agile, dynamic environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.
* Continuously learn through ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities.
* Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.
* Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.
* Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.
* Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.


**Ethics at ADP:** ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Regional Sales Representative
description:
Overview: We are currently looking for a talented, dynamic and motivated outside sales professional to join our team in the **Middletown, NY** Market Area. Reporting to an Region Sales and Business Development Manager, in this position you will independently prospect, develop and nurture relationships with businesses and industry entities. Responsibilities:
* Develop new sales leads by prospecting and pursuing targeted new business through calling or visiting potential customers, attending trade shows, initiating mailings and other related activities
* Negotiate and close new sales contracts and service agreements to achieve year over year customer base growth
* Develop and leverage relationships with businesses and industry entities such as real estate companies, home builder associations and other trade organizations to cultivate new business prospects
* Actively participate in industry organizations to continually build a professional network
* Partner with Regional Management and the National Accounts group to aggressively pursue Regional and National Accounts business opportunities
* Champion a positive, professional image of Suburban Propane to create customer goodwill and foster referrals and repeat business
* Follow up with new accounts to ensure customer satisfaction and fulfillment of the job

  

**Why join the Suburban Propane team?** Because we care about the physical, mental, and financial wellbeing of our employees and provide them with competitive pay plus incentive potential and an outstanding benefits package including:  

* Medical, dental, and vision (eligibility after just 30 days of employment)
* Paid time off that increases with tenure
* A 401(k) with company match and immediate vesting
* A new employee training program and many opportunities for continued learning and career development
* Disability and life insurance
* Employee recognition program
* Generous tuition assistance program
* Propane discounts, and more!

  

For eligibility and a full list of our benefit offerings please visit: https://jobs.suburbanpropane.com/benefits/ .  

  

Starting base salary\\*: $60,000 (plus commission)  

  

* Subject to change over time, to allow adequate time to build a commissionable platform. Qualifications:
* Minimum of 5 years of business-to-business sales experience
* Some college or equivalent in experience and education (Business related Bachelor's Degree preferred)
* Excellent verbal communication skills including the ability to negotiate and convincingly persuade others
* Professional and articulate with an enthusiastic and positive attitude
* Industry knowledge is preferred but not required
* Basic understanding of oil and gas fired appliances and related distribution systems (training is provided)

  

**As part of our pre-employment hiring process, background checks and drug screens are performed.**  

**Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.**  

  

Headquartered in Whippany, New Jersey, Suburban Propane Partners, L.P. (NYSE:SPH) is a nationwide marketer and distributor of a diverse array of products to meet the energy needs of our customers, specializing in heating oil and refined fuels, as well as the marketing of propane, natural gas and electricity in deregulated markets. With over 3,000 employees and as the 3rd largest propane retailer in the country, Suburban Propane maintains business operations in 42 states, providing prompt, reliable service to over one million residential, commercial, industrial and agricultural customers. We are committed to supporting the growth and innovation of propane as a sustainable energy source and investing in the next generation of even cleaner and lower carbon renewable energy sources.  

  

It's an amazing time to become a part of our team as we expand our national footprint and  

  

make strides toward a sustainable, clean energy future!  

  

At Suburban Propane, we know that our strength comes from our diverse and inclusive team of employees who make a difference in the communities we serve across the country every day. All applicants for employment shall be considered without regard to race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, age, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  

  

For more information about our hiring process, please visit: https://jobs.suburbanpropane.com/our-hiring-process/

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
**Administrative Assistant**

**Job Summary:** -The Administrative Assistant I performs a variety of administrative functions. -This position reports to a manager and provides assistance utilizing secretarial support skills to maintain departmental operation. Essential Generic Job Functions (List in order of importance): -Schedules appointments, meetings or conferences for departmental personnel utilizing interdepartmental and/or hospital wide computerized scheduling systems. -Prioritizes calls through screening process, transfers calls, records messages, and delivers to appropriate personnel. -Coordinates special projects as instructed, composes memos, transcribes notes, and researches and creates presentations. -Generates reports, handles multiple projects, and prepares and monitors invoices and expense reports. -Takes and/or transcribes minutes at meetings. -Reviews and distributes daily mail correspondence to appropriate personnel. -Orders office supplies and maintains inventory. -Maintains up-to-date departmental manuals and files. -May assist with compiling and developing the annual budget. -Relies on instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job. -Lifts a minimum of 10lbs., pushes and pulls a minimum of 15lbs. and stands a minimum of 1 hour a day. -Adheres to the standards identified in the Medical Center’s Organizational Competencies

**Required Skills & Experience:** -Proficient in computer skills including Microsoft Office Applications.

**Preferred Skills & Experience:** -Experience in health care or corporate sectors.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Urgent Care Office Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**


The Office Manager is the onsite manager responsible for the day-to-day operations of the practice. The Office Manager reports to the Director of Operations.

  


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Oversees daily office operations. Identifies and resolves operational problems.
* Supervises assigned personnel. Reconciles employee time cards
* Prepares payroll for employees.
* Assists with hiring and training of assigned staff.
* Oversees and maintains Providers schedules. Adjusting the schedules based on changes making sure all patients are rescheduled.
* Overseeing the daily operations of the Front Desk and Medical Assistant department.
* Overseeing medical records request.
* Opening mail and organizing invoices/packing slips
* Answering billing emails from billing manager in regards to missing information, coding issue, etc.
* Ordering supplies for offices and maintaining stock of supplies.
* Travel to other locations if need be to help manage multiply locations.
* Can fill in as medical assistant and front desk if need be.
* Can do prior authorizations if need be.
* Maintains patient confidentiality.
* Performs other related duties as directed or required.


  

Category Business Support
  

Exempt/Non-Exempt Exempt
  

Location Stony Brook Gynecology & Obstetrics - OB/GYN
  

Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time
  

Position Requirements
**Performance Requirements**


**Knowledge**:


* Knowledge of clinic policies and procedures.
* Knowledge of medical terminology and insurance practices.
* Knowledge of computer programs and applications.
* Knowledge of grammar, spelling and punctuation to communicate in written format.
* Knowledge of CPT and ICD-9 coding.
* Knowledge of managed care, Medicare, and Medicaid guidelines.

  




**Skills**:


* Skill in effective personnel management including training staff and delegating duties.
* Skill in written and verbal communication.

  




**Abilities**:


* Ability to work effectively as a team member with physicians and other staff.
* Ability to flexibly respond to changing demands.
* Ability to plan, organize, prioritize and direct the work of others.
* Ability to identify problems and recommend solutions.
* Ability to sort and file materials correctly by alphabetic or numeric systems.
* Ability to interpret and understand insurance benefits and reimbursement.
* Ability to communicate clearly and concisely.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with patients, employees, and the public.

  




**Qualifications**:


* High School Diploma
* 3 Years minimum prior experience in a healthcare office setting
* Possess and utilize exceptional organizations skills, interpersonal skills and proper phone etiquette
* Computer and/or EMR experience

  




**Physical Demands**:


Must be able to sit for long periods of time, and must have manual dexterity to work computer systems and keyboard. May spend a great deal of their professional day walking, standing, moving and manipulating equipment, as well as lifting and moving objects, equipment and supplies. It is reasonable to anticipate lifting 20-25 pounds in any given day. Bending or twisting of the body may also be a frequent occurrence.

  


  

Shift Days
  

Tags Benefits,401K, PTO, Life Insurance, Student loan reimbursement
  

Salary Range $60,000-$68,000 annually
  

Position Office Manager

title: Trade Commodity Finance Analyst Intern
description:
Trade Commodity Finance is part of a global business with dedicated teams Singapore, Utrecht, New York, Sao Paulo and Buenos Aires. TCF New York includes three sectors: agriculture (i.e. TCF Agri), metals (i.e., TCF Metals and Minerals) and energy (i.e., TCF Energy).

**Our Shared Future**

**“Our Rabobank North America internship program serves as our primary source of identifying and developing new talent. This summer training program is designed to offer our interns a learning experience where they actively contribute to the business and explore the career paths that Rabobank offers worldwide.” – David Bassett, Head of Wholesale Banking North America**

***You and Your Job:***


The Analyst works with Relationship Managers (RM) and Credit Analysts (CA) to assist in the origination of new clients and business, preparation of pitches and sector analyses and management of the existing portfolio of clients.


The Analyst will learn TCF business and TCF products with RMs, Credit, Middle Office and Operation/Trade Services. They will work with RM/CA to assess industry trends, identify prospects, prepare customer marketing materials such as pitch books and follow up presentations. The analyst will also assist RM/CA in analyzing credit risk, structure credit products, financial modelling/ Capital assessments via internal models for prospects/new transactions.

***Job Responsibilities:***

* Attend customer meetings with RM and actively contribute to discussion and development of the relationship. Assists with the preparation of call reports.
* Assist in the active management of client relationships and works with credit analysts and commodity support group to prepare credit review or portfolio reviews
* Assist RM/CA managing ongoing credit needs of existing relationships.
* Assist in researching and evaluating specific target industries.
* Work on monthly/ quarterly assessment of received information & covenant checks.
* Assist in monitoring assigned portfolio of clients; in depth client knowledge is essential for adequately identifying early warning signals with the aim of minimizing loan losses.
* Initiating where necessary extra measures in order to safeguard the credit portfolio.

**Your Promise to Us**


To be considered for the Trade Commodity Finance Analyst Intern role, you must:

* Be pursuing a B.S. in Accounting, Finance, Economics or International Business
* Have excellent academic performance
* Be willing to learn and hard-working
* Possess high level of computer skills
* Possess basic knowledge of credit analysis, laws, policies, procedures and facts relevant to a general lending and marketing
* Think critically and exhibit intellectual curiosity
* Exhibit excellent writing and verbal communications skills.
* Have the ability to handle multiple projects/tasks
* Be self-motivated and able to work independently
* Be a team player with desire to work collaboratively within the team
* Cash flow analysis and projections proficiency are a plus

**Our Commitment to You**


Rabobank embraces diversity and welcomes employees and applicants of all backgrounds. Our goal is to always create an environment that is inclusive, drawing upon the strengths of the diversity of our workforce to exceed the expectations of our clients and customers.

***Internship Overview:***


Rabobank’s internship program is designed to provide a mutually beneficial relationship and growth opportunity for Rabobank and collegiate students. This experiential learning opportunity provides practical application and skills development in a professional environment and is aligned with Rabobank’s commitment to recruit top talent in the communities we serve. While employed as a summer intern, students will have the opportunity to prove their ability to learn and demonstrate key skills that will make them successful at Rabobank. To aid in this endeavor, students will be matched with a mentor and provided the necessary professional development opportunities to achieve their goals. The internship will be a full time, 10-week, paid program.

***Our Organization:***


Serving clients in Mexico, the U.S. and Canada, Rabobank Wholesale Banking North America is a premier corporate and investment bank to the food, agribusiness, commodities and renewable energy industries, providing sector expertise, strategic advisory and tailored financial solutions to our clients. We thrive on building long-term relationships with clients and stakeholders in the fastest-growing food and agribusiness region of the world. See, https://www.rabobankwholesalebankingna.com/.

**Salary Expectations:**

**Target Hiring Range: $49.50/hour**


This position is subject to the terms of [RAF/Rabobank/RDS]’s compensation plans and policies. It is anticipated that the position will pay within the target hiring range. The range is reflective of the desired primary physical work location and may be adjusted outside of the projected range based on geographical differentiation if the actual work location of the hired candidate differs from the desired primary location, or for other lawful reasons. Further, all full-time regular position includes all other benefits provided to [RAF/Rabobank/RDS] employees, including healthcare benefits, 401k matching, vacation, sick leave, parental leave, possible discretionary bonuses and all other benefits that are all governed by and subject to ERISA plan documents and eligibility.

title: Summer Analyst - Energy Transition
description:
Summer Analyst - Energy Transition


As an Energy Transition Analyst, you will be part of a new and growing team in North America, contributing to Rabobank’s global vision to become a leading Energy Transition bank. You will be responsible for providing a broad range of analytical and transaction support and work on deal teams for live transactions with a lot of senior management visibility. Tasks include preparation of marketing materials, financial modelling and credit analysis of client transactions, assessment of sustainability metrics, etc.

**Our Shared Future:**

**“Our Rabobank North America internship program serves as our primary source of identifying and developing new talent. This summer training program is designed to offer our interns a learning experience where they actively contribute to the business and explore the career paths that Rabobank offers worldwide.” – David Bassett, Head of Wholesale Banking North America**

***You and Your Job***


As an Energy Transition Analyst, you will be successful by working closely with the Relationship Management team and other internal partners, in order to close transactions in a manner that leaves clients thoroughly satisfied with our knowledge of their businesses and our responsiveness to their needs.


Rabobank’s Energy Transition team is focused on providing financial products and services to clients involved in the broader renewable energy and sustainability sectors, including solar, wind, batteries, energy efficiency, electronic vehicles and waste-to-value, among others. The Energy Transition Coverage team will look to bring all of Rabobank’s products and services to its renewable energy, public utilities, and equity investor clientele. The team’s goal is to support the decarbonization of the energy sector based on market knowledge and a client focused approach. In the 10-week summer internship program, you will join various deal teams, across both our Energy Transition team and our Project Finance team, and will play a critical role in technical due diligence, financial modeling, market research, and business opportunity development.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Actively working with deal team members to generate, structure, and execute energy transition and project finance transactions.
* Conducting financial and valuation analysis using accounting principles and corporate valuation methods
* Understanding key financing risks and recommending mitigants to alleviate such risks
* Creating and preparing marketing materials for internal stakeholder alignment and external business development
* Developing research products including assessment of corporate sustainability metrics, utility generation mixes, and white papers on new and emerging technologies in the energy transition ecosystem.
* Participating in client calls, managing internal legal and compliance requirements, and understanding the lifecycle of Energy Transition and Project Finance transactions.

**Your Promise to Us:**

To be considered for the Summer Analyst, Energy Transition role, you must:

* Be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program
* Have a good attitude and a willingness to learn quickly and think nimbly.

**Our Commitment to You**


Rabobank embraces diversity and welcomes employees and applicants of all backgrounds. Our goal is to always create an environment that is inclusive, drawing upon the strengths of the diversity of our workforce to exceed the expectations of our clients and customers.

**Internship Overview:**


Rabobank’s internship program is designed to provide a mutually beneficial relationship and growth opportunity for Rabobank and collegiate students. This experiential learning opportunity provides practical application and skills development in a professional environment and is aligned with Rabobank’s commitment to recruit top talent in the communities we serve. To aid in this endeavor, students will be matched with a mentor and provided the necessary professional development opportunities to achieve their goals. We thrive on building long-term relationships with clients and stakeholders in the fastest-growing food and agribusiness region of the world. See, https://www.rabobankwholesalebankingna.com/

**Target Hiring Range: $49.50/hour**


This position is subject to the terms of [RAF/Rabobank/RDS]’s compensation plans and policies. It is anticipated that the position will pay within the target hiring range. title: Summer Associate - Project Finance
description:
The Project Finance Summer Associate will have a unique opportunity to work with a growing Project Finance Americas team, responsible for structuring and executing prudent and profitable renewable energy project financing transactions. The PF Summer Associate will have exposure to a broad range of technologies (e.g. solar, wind, battery, energy efficiency, fuel cells and EV's) as well as transaction structures (e.g. traditional project finance, equipment finance and portfolio financing). Our team is committed to your growth: The PF Summer Associate will be an integral of deal teams and will have the opportunity to learn from colleagues with different experience levels and fields of expertise.

**Our Shared Future:**

**“Our Rabobank North America internship program serves as our primary source of identifying and developing new talent. This summer training program is designed to offer our interns a learning experience where they actively contribute to the business and explore the career paths that Rabobank offers worldwide.” – David Bassett, Head of Wholesale Banking North America**

***You and Your Job***


As a Summer Associate - Project Finance you will be successful by reviewing and executing finance opportunities in the Energy Transition sector as well as work on project to enhance the expertise of the team on relevant current themes in the renewables industry


The PF Summer Associate will be expected to:

* Act as an essential deal team members in structuring, and executing renewable energy financing transactions
* Build relationships within the organization and industry stakeholders
* Gain and share expertise on various renewable energy technologies and financing structures
* Be able to review and analyse technical reports, insurance reports and financial models.

**Job Responsibilities**


Day-to-day responsibilities to include:

* Constructing Evaluating financial models for renewable energy projects and other project finance transactions
* Understanding key financing risks and recommending mitigants to alleviate such risks
* Reviewing key project documents, including Power Purchase Agreements, Engineering, Procurement, and Construction Agreements, and Operations and Maintenance Agreements
* Reviewing financing agreements
* Assessing transmission, market, independent engineering, appraisal, and insurance consultant reports
* Drafting internal transaction documents and credit memos

**Your Promise to Us:**

To be considered for the Summer Associate - Project Finance role, you must have:

* At least one year of work experience that involves financial modelling
* Basic knowledge in project finance and key risk factors in project finance transactions
* Previous experiences in investment banking, investment research, or renewable energy project development is preferred
* Be passionate about renewable energy and the broader Energy Transition
* Be currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program

**Our Commitment to You**


Rabobank embraces diversity and welcomes employees and applicants of all backgrounds. Our goal is to always create an environment that is inclusive, drawing upon the strengths of the diversity of our workforce to exceed the expectations of our clients and customers.

title: Title IX Coordinator - SUNY Maritime College
description:
**Location:** Bronx, NY **Category:** Administrative & Professional **Posted On:** Sat Sep 14 2024 **Job Description:**  

  

The Title IX Coordinator will report directly to the Dean of Students, and have a dotted line report to the Assistant Vice President for Human Resources & Chief Diversity Officer of the College. Responsibilities include investigating claims of sexual discrimination, harassment, sexual assault, violence or misconduct and identifying the appropriate responses or resolutions as may be prescribed by Policy and Law.


The Title IX Coordinator will work with the complainant(s) to assist them in accessing any appropriate internal and external support services. The incumbent will work closely with the Dean of Students on setting and executing policy and overseeing the processes that address reported concerns or claims of sex or gender-based harassment, discrimination, sexual misconduct or sexual violence.


This position is also responsible for the development, oversight, and coordination of campus-wide education, training, and outreach programming for students, faculty, and staff related to Title IX, Clery Act and VAWA. Summer Sea Term is a 70 to 75-day training program aboard the College's training ship that may include visits to domestic and international ports. It is a requirement for the incumbent to annually participate, unless expressly waived by the Master of the Training Ship.


**Responsibilities include:**


* Investigate claims of sexual discrimination, harassment, sexual assault, violence or misconduct
* Identify the appropriate responses or facilitate resolutions to complaints as may be prescribed by Policy and Law.
* Day-to-day application and review of College policies and practices to ensure compliance with, Title IX, Title VII and other Equal Opportunity laws at both the State and Federal levels
* Assume primary responsibility for monitoring all amendments and interpretations to Title IX, the Clery Act, the Violence Against Women Act and other applicable laws and regulations
* Coordinate and conduct prevention, and education training to SUNY Maritime students and staff pursuant to Title IX and related statutes and regulations
* Stay abreast of regulations and statutes and disseminate information of Title IX requirements
* Organize and maintain faculty and staff compliance records for required training
* Assisting the Office of Human Resource Services, Office of General Counsel with complaints of discrimination, harassment, and sexual harassment and work with the appropriate offices to advise staff, faculty and students of the college's policy and procedure regarding nondiscrimination and other Title IX matters
* Support inclusive excellence of SUNY Maritime Diversity Plan for equity and inclusion
* Collaborating with academic and administrative liaisons such as University Police, Athletics, Empire Training Ship, and the Office of Human Resource Services/Office of Diversity
* Preparing statistical reports for the compliance of the Annual Security Report which complies with Clery Act
* Working with the appropriate offices to review reports on crime statistics provided by University Police
* Coordinate with the training ship staff onboard for Title IX investigation and make recommendations to shore side management in respect to investigation procedures
* As directed by supervisors and administrative authorities, participate in the Summer Sea Term training program as the college's designated SASH contact
* Supports the Mental Health initiatives

  

**Job Requirements:** ***Required Qualifications:***


* Bachelor's degree
* 3-5 years of professional experience working with Title IX related issues
* Demonstrated knowledge of and ability to interpret federal and state equal opportunity and non-discrimination laws and regulations, including Title IX, sexual harassment and other applicable laws and regulations
* Strong counseling, negotiation, presentation and organizational skills
* Excellent communication skills: writing, speaking, listening
* Computer literacy and ability to handle extremely sensitive and confidential matters discreetly
* Ability to conduct research and analyze data and draw conclusions
* Previous experience with and training in conducting investigatory processes and responding to complaints
* Experience dealing with student conduct adjudication, investigations, dispute resolution, and compliance


***Preferred Qualifications:***


* Master's Degree in Higher Education administration, legal studies, Juris Doctor, or related
* Understanding of higher education policy issues at both the state and federal levels
* Experience in a public institution of higher education

  

**Additional Information:** **Classification/Salary Range:** The Title IX Coordinator is a full-time calendar year Management/Confidential unclassified position which serves at the President's pleasure. The anticipated salary range for the position is $65,000.00 to $80,000.00 annually with an outstanding benefits package (for additional information, please see the Management Confidential Unclassified Benefits Summary) http://?https://www.suny.edu/media/suny/content-assets/documents/benefits/benefit-summaries/MCunclassifiedbenefitsummary-July-2024.pdf. Note that the salary will commensurate with qualifications and experience. Review of applications to commence immediately and conclude when the position is filled.


S**pecial Notes:** This is a full-time calendar year appointment. Fair Labor Standard Acts (FLSA) Exempt position, not eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA. Internal and external search to occur simultaneously. The position may require working a non-traditional schedule in order to accommodate the operational needs of the College and requires some travel.


**Budget Title:** Executive Assistant to the President  

**Local Title:** Title IX Coordinator  

**Line #:** 00188

  


SUNY Maritime College is an Equal Opportunity/Veterans/Disabled/Affirmative Action employer, committed to recruiting, supporting and fostering a diverse community of outstanding faculty, staff and students. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. For our full non-discrimination statement, see: http://www.sunymaritime.edu/affirmative-action.


SUNY Maritime College is committed to maintaining a safe environment for its students, faculty, staff, volunteers and the general public that use our facilities. Therefore, in order to ensure the hiring of employees of the highest integrity and to maintain a safe campus community, SUNY Maritime College will conduct pre-employment background investigations on all individuals for whom employment is to be offered.


Pursuant to Executive Order 161, no State entity, as defined by the Executive Order, is permitted to ask, or mandate, in any form, that an applicant for employment provide his or her current compensation, or any prior compensation history, until such time as the applicant is extended a conditional offer of employment with compensation. If such information has been requested from you before such time, please contact the Office of Employee Relations at (518) 474-6988 or via email at info@goer.ny.gov.


In accordance with the Title II Crime Awareness and Security Act, a copy of our crime statistics is available upon request by calling (718) 409-7305. It can also be viewed online by selecting University Police > Safety Information > Clery Safety Report (Annual Security & File Safety).

title: Flyer Distributor
description:
**Job Description:**


We are seeking enthusiastic and outgoing individuals to join our team as Seasonal Summer Flyer Distributors for our dental office. This short-term position is perfect for anyone who enjoys being outdoors, interacting with people, and promoting our office.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Sit outside our dental office and distribute flyers and promotional items with a bottle of water to passersby.
* Engage with individuals in a friendly and positive manner.
* Hand out promotional items and provide basic information about our dental services.
* Encourage people to visit our office for a free consultation.
* Direct interested individuals to the office upstairs to schedule appointments.
* Salary: $18 an hour

**Qualifications:**

* No prior experience required.
* Friendly, outgoing, and enthusiastic personality.
* Comfortable interacting with a diverse range of people.
* Reliable and punctual.
* Ability to stand for extended periods.
* Enjoy working outdoors in varying weather conditions.

title: General Dentist with Pediatric Focus Wanted!
description:
Are you a General Dentist with a heart for pediatric care? At New York Family Dentistry, we’re on a mission to broaden our services to meet the needs of our diverse patient community. We’re seeking an exceptional General Dentist with a special interest in Pediatric Dentistry to join our growing team!

### **Why Join Us?**


At New York Family Dentistry, we believe in more than just providing dental care – we create lasting smiles and build trust with our patients from their very first visit. When you become part of our family, you’ll benefit from:

**Competitive Compensation:** Enjoy a guaranteed high market-competitive salary of $900 per day, plus an attractive bonus structure.

**Transportation Subsidy:** We support your commute to ensure it’s as smooth as possible.

**Collaborative Environment:** Work alongside a supportive, patient-focused team that’s committed to your professional growth.

**Advanced Technology:** Access the latest dental tools and technologies to deliver top-tier care.

**Diverse Patient Base:** Serve a broad spectrum of patients across the vibrant neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens, including a significant pediatric population.

**F****amily Atmosphere:** Thrive in a warm, welcoming environment with an emphasis on team collaboration and development.


### **About the Role**


As a General Dentist with a pediatric focus at New York Family Dentistry, you’ll blend your clinical skills with a nurturing approach to provide exceptional care to both children and adults. Your role will involve creating positive dental experiences for our youngest patients, while also offering comprehensive care to our broader patient base.

### **What Makes You a Great Fit:**

* A genuine love for working with children and making their dental visits fun and stress-free.
* A caring and patient-centered approach that reassures even the most nervous patients.
* Strong communication skills to effectively connect with both young patients and their parents.
* Problem-solving abilities to address a wide range of dental issues with confidence.
* A meticulous, detail-oriented approach ensures the highest quality of care in every procedure.
* Excellent time management and multitasking skills to succeed in our dynamic, fast-paced environment.


### **Requirements**

* DDS or DMD from an accredited dental school.
* Completion of an accredited dentistry residency program.
* Active New York State Dental License.
* Interest or experience in Pediatric Dentistry.
* Availability to work alternating Saturdays.

title: Project Manager
description:
Are you a talented professional with a robust background project and task management seeking an exciting opportunity to showcase your skills? Look no further! As a Project Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in seamlessly managing and overseeing a variety of projects within our dynamic team.

**Why join New York Family Dentistry?**

* Team and Growth focused organization
* Family atmosphere with a real focus on Team Training and Development
* Be a part of a Team who are expanding their impact for Oral Health in Brooklyn and Queens
* Have a real impact on a daily basis for both our team and patient
* Market competitive package

  


**Job Overview:**  

As our Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in seamlessly managing and overseeing a diverse range of projects. Leveraging your expertise in Asana, Slack, and Google Workspace, you will ensure project deadlines are met through effective coordination with team members. Your creative flair will shine as you contribute to branding efforts using design tools like Canva, while your experience in dental / medial related roles will be key in supporting patient relations and service line reporting. Additionally, your adaptability and problem-solving skills will be crucial in handling miscellaneous tasks and providing valuable support in our dynamic work environment. If you're ready to make a significant impact and advance your career, apply now and become an integral part of our innovative and collaborative team!

**Key Competencies**

* Project Management
* Dental Operations
* Administrative Support
* Technology Proficiency
* Communication Skills
* Adaptability and Problem-Solving


**Roles & Responsibilities**

**Project Administration:** Utilize your proficiency in Asana, Slack, and Google Workspace. Coordinate effectively with different team members to ensure project deadlines are met. Leverage your organizational skills to oversee project timelines and deliverables


**Content Professionalization**: Being able to develop and work with fellow team members in creating content across the organization.
 

**Apply your design skills:** Using tools such as Canva to contribute to branding efforts, including business cards and marketing materials.


**Website management:** Maintain professional online presence, including content optimization and updates.


**Marketing initiatives:** Support the creation, management and refinement of marketing activity


**Dental Operations:** Support the wider organization with patient interactions and contact center activity.
 

**Miscellaneous Support:** Assist the wider organization, along with onboarding processes. The role also handles various one-off tasks as they arise, showcasing your adaptability and problem-solving skills.


**Key Skills and Qualifications:**

* Adaptability to new priorities and comfortable tolerating ambiguity
* Ability to adapt quickly to new challenges and technologies.
* Capable handling miscellaneous tasks and providing support in a dynamic work environment.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Business related qualification, project coordination / management


Salary: $30,000-300,000


Join us in making a positive impact and advancing your career! Apply now and become a key player in our innovative and collaborative team.

title: Patient Care Caller
description:
**Patient Care Caller**


Are you an organized, adaptable, and experienced communicator ready to make a difference in patient care? Join our team across five practices in Brooklyn and Queens as a Patient Care Caller.

**Responsibilities:**

* Reach out to patients via phone calls to follow up on their recent medical appointments or treatments.
* Listen attentively to patients' concerns, questions, and feedback regarding their care experience.
* Provide empathetic and knowledgeable responses to address patients' inquiries or escalate issues to appropriate personnel for resolution.
* Accurately and thoroughly document all interactions with patients in our database or electronic medical records system.
* Ensure compliance with all patient privacy and confidentiality regulations (e.g., HIPAA) during interactions.
* Participate in ongoing training to stay updated on healthcare procedures, policies, and best practices.
* Maintain a positive and supportive attitude towards patients, colleagues, and healthcare professionals.

  


**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in healthcare or customer service is a plus.
* Proven experience in a customer service or patient care role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, conveying empathy and professionalism over the phone.
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with patients from diverse backgrounds.
* Detail-oriented and organized, with multitasking and prioritization abilities.
* Proficiency in using computers and electronic medical records systems; familiarity with CRM software is advantageous.
* Ability to remain calm and composed in challenging or emotional situations.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining patient confidentiality.
* Flexibility to work shifts that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays based on operational needs.


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Dental Patient Relations Specialist
description:
Join our team as a Patient Relations Specialist, enhancing patient experience across our offices in Brooklyn and Queens. Join a team that is focued on delivery the best patient experience to ensure that our patients keep returning for their oral health care.


Key Responsibilities:

**Enhance Patient Experience:** Resolve patient feedback and concerns promptly and efficiently via phone, text, and email.

**Conflict Resolution:** Own and manage all patient feedback programs, working closely with team. Implement strategies to resolve conflicts and enhance patient satisfaction.

**Analytics:** Collaborate with the team to develop reporting mechanisms and communication processes. Identify performance improvement opportunities for team members.

**Patient Satisfaction:** Work with all departments to set and communicate performance expectations related to patient experience. Design and execute initiatives to enhance the overall patient experience.


Experience & Skills  



  

**Experience:**

* Minimum 5 years in a dental office setting.
* Proficiency in Dentrix Ascend, Google Workspace, Slack, Asana, and ADA billing guidelines.
* Knowledge of dental insurances, including PPO, DMO, DHMO (Capitation), and NYS Managed Care Programs
* Understanding of in-network/out-of-network benefits and fee-for-service models.
* Familiarity with general dentistry and orthodontics procedures and treatments.


**Technical Skills:**

* Proficient in data entry and analysis, with experience using Excel and other similar programs.

**Soft Skills:**

  

* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* High attention to detail.
* Outstanding organizational and multitasking skills.


Requirements:

 **Remote Work:**

* High-speed internet and a dedicated workspace to ensure productivity.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality regarding sensitive issues.


Why Join Us?

  

If you're organized, detail-oriented, and passionate about improving patient experiences, we want to hear from you! Join a team dedicated to providing safe and compassionate care, building strong patient relationships, and fostering a supportive work environment.


Take the next step in your career and help us make a difference in our patients' lives. Apply now to become a key part of our dynamic team!

  

Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Dental Billing Specialist
description:
We seek a highly organized, adaptable, and experienced Dental Billing Specialist for our six practices in Brooklyn and Queens.


The Dental Billing Specialist is responsible for achieving the revenue targets of the practice. This person must have prior dental billing experience and be familiar with Government and Commercial Insurance plans.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Develop and Implement effective billing/collection policies and procedures
* Ensure compliance with government and third-party regulations
* Optimize insurance payer contract, pricing, and reimbursement rates
* Oversee timely claim submission and manage the aging process minimizing denials
* Conduct pre- and post-appointment audits
* Handle insurance calls and facilitate the correction of claims/refunds

  

**Qualifications:**


* 5+ years of dental billing experience
* Proficiency in Dentrix Ascend, Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana
* Strong knowledge of PPO, DMO, DHMO, and NYS Managed Care Programs
* Understanding of in-network/out-of-network benefits and fee-for-service
* Up-to-date knowledge of ADA billing guidelines and CDT coding
* Strong knowledge of third party financing; Lending Club, Alphaeon, Care Credit, etc.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent critical thinking and organizational skills
* Positive attitude and strong problem-solving abilities

**General Skills:**


* Proficiency in data entry and analysis
* Strong interpersonal skills and teamwork
* Ability to multitask and manage projects effectively


Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Oral Surgeon - Part Time, Once a week!
description:
**Join Our Team at New York Family Dentistry: Experience the Future of Oral Health Care!**


New York Family Dentistry is excited to expand our services to include Oral Surgery alongside top-notch general dentistry. As our organization evolves, we're seeking passionate individuals to join us in making a difference in the lives of our patients.

**Why Join Us?**


* Earn a competitive salary ranging from $500,000 to $999,000 annually, with bonus incentives to reward your hard work and dedication.
* Access cutting-edge dental technology that empowers you to provide the highest quality care and stay at the forefront of your field.
* Serve a diverse and dynamic patient base in Brooklyn and Queens, including under-served populations, providing you with a rewarding and fulfilling experience.
* Make a meaningful impact by providing essential oral health care to those who may not otherwise have access to it, ensuring equitable treatment for all.
* Work alongside a dedicated support team focused on patient care, in a collaborative and nurturing environment that emphasizes team training and development.


**About the Role**


As a part-time Oral Surgeon at New York Family Dentistry, you'll have the opportunity to leverage your clinical expertise and interpersonal skills to provide exceptional oral health care. Join a team that prioritizes patient well-being and values effective collaboration among dental professionals.

**Ideal Candidate Qualities**


* Compassionate and patient-centric approach to care
* Strong communication skills and problem-solving aptitude
* Detail-oriented mindset with excellent time management and multitasking abilities


**Requirements**


* Doctor of Dental Surgery (DDS) or Doctor of Dental Medicine (DMD) degree from an accredited dental school.
* Completion of an accredited oral and maxillofacial surgery residency program.
* Active state dental license, with specific licensure required for the state where the practice is located.
* Board certification or eligibility for certification by the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (ABOMS) or equivalent certification body.
* Proficiency in a wide range of oral surgical procedures, including but not limited to tooth extractions, dental implants, jaw surgeries, and oral pathology management.
* Experience in administering anesthesia and sedation for surgical procedures.
* Willingness to stay updated on advancements in oral and maxillofacial surgery techniques and technologies through continuing education and professional development activities.
* Compliance with all relevant legal and ethical standards in the practice of oral surgery.


**Ready to Join Us?**


If you're passionate about delivering high-quality dental care and thrive in a supportive and welcoming environment, we invite you to apply for our part-time Oral Surgeon position. To submit your application, please send your resume and cover letter. We eagerly anticipate hearing from you and welcoming you to our team!

title: Treatment Coordinator - Foreign Trained Dentist
description:
**Join Our Team as a Treatment Coordinator - Foreign Trained Dentist**  

  

New York Family Dentistry is seeking a highly motivated and skilled individual with a **foreign dental education** background to join our team as a Treatment Coordinator.


This role offers a fantastic career opportunity for **foreign-trained dentists** looking to advance their professional and personal experience.


As a Treatment Coordinator, you'll play a pivotal role in our continued success, contributing to our organizational workflow and working alongside talented professionals dedicated to excellence.

**Key Responsibilities**:

  

* Greet patients warmly, creating a welcoming atmosphere.
* Encourage and support nervous patients, recognizing their efforts to seek dental care.
* Educate patients on the clinical benefits of dental treatment and explain insurance benefits and out-of-pocket costs.
* Collaborate with a team to assist patients with third-party financing Assist patients in completing financing applications and educate them on credit check processes.
* Creative problem-solving to help patients achieve their oral health needs. Documented
* Hand off paperwork to the front desk for processing and upload to patient charts.
* Leave comprehensive notes on treatment discussions, financial costs, and necessary prior approvals for efficient patient care.

**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

  

Be part of a company transforming the field of dentistry, and work with cutting-edge technology and industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions. We iwill invest in your professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.


Come join a diverse, welcoming, and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity, and open communication.


This role provides competitive compensation and benefits, we offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work.

**Requirements:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Dental professional qualification
* Excellent knowledge of dental insurances, specifically PPO, DMO, DHMO (Capitation), and NYS Managed Care Program
* Experience in healthcare or sales setting
* Familiarity with ADA codes
* Eligible to work in the US

  

Salary: $30,000-300,000

title: Chairside Dental Assistant - Queens Based
description:
**Position Overview:**


At NYFD, we are a trailblazing company at the forefront of dentistry. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work culture, encouraging fresh ideas and empowering our employees to achieve their full potential. As a Chairside dental assistant you will play a pivotal role in driving our continued success. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the organizational workflow and work alongside a team of talented professionals who are dedicated to pushing boundaries and delivering exceptional results.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform diagnostic procedures such as panoramic x-rays, bitewings, and intraoral photos, as well as Itero scans.
* Ensure proper sterilization of dental tools and equipment to maintain a safe and hygienic environment.
* Maintain clean and organized operatories for efficient patient care.
* Respond promptly and courteously to patient inquiries, concerns, and needs, ensuring a positive patient experience.
* Provide a warm welcome and friendly demeanor to all patients, making them feel comfortable and at ease in the dental office.

  


**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

**Meaningful Impact:** Be part of a company that is transforming dentistry.

**Innovative Environment:** Work with cutting-edge technology and collaborate with industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions.


**Growth Opportunities:** We invest in our employees' professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.

**Collaborative Culture:** Join a diverse, welcoming and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity, and open communication.

* Team celebrations and quarterly meetings

**Competitive Compensation and Benefits:** We offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work. ️

* Benefits Package Available
* Salary: starting at $20 per hour depending on experience
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday

**Requirements:**


To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Completion of a dental assistant program or equivalent training
* English as second language welcome

title: General Dentist - Available on Fridays
description:
Join Our Team: Exceptional General Dentist Wanted!


Are you ready to elevate your dental career to new heights? New York Family Dentistry is on a mission to expand the scope of care we offer to our diverse patient community, and we're searching for an outstanding General Dentist to join our dynamic team!


Why Join Us?


At New York Family Dentistry, we're more than just a dental practice – we're a passionate team dedicated to delivering exceptional care and creating beautiful smiles. When you join our family, you'll enjoy:

* A high market-competitive salary of $900 a day guaranteed, plus an enticing bonus structure
* Transportation subsidy to make your commute hassle-free
* Supportive and patient-focused team members who are committed to your success
* Access to the latest advancements in dental technology to enhance your practice
* An extensive and diverse patient base in the vibrant neighborhoods of Brooklyn and Queens
* A warm and welcoming family atmosphere with a strong emphasis on team training and development

**About the Role**


As a General Dentist at New York Family Dentistry, you'll harness the power of your clinical expertise and warm personality to deliver outstanding oral health care and unforgettable patient experiences. This role requires a deep commitment to patient care and the ability to collaborate seamlessly with our talented dental team.


If You Have These Amazing Qualities, You're the Perfect Fit:

* Caring and compassionate demeanor that puts patients at ease
* Patience and empathy to address our patients' diverse needs and concerns
* Excellent communication skills to connect authentically with patients and colleagues
* Strong problem-solving abilities to tackle any dental challenge with confidence
* Detail-oriented approach to ensure precision and excellence in every procedure
* Stellar time management and multitasking skills to thrive in our fast-paced environment

**Requirements**

* DDS or DMD from an accredited dental school
* Completion of an accredited dentistry residency program
* Active New York State Dental License
* Ability to work on Fridays


If you're passionate about providing top-notch dental care and crave a supportive and friendly work environment, then look no further – you've found your perfect job! Submit your application today, along with your resume and cover letter, and take the next step in your dental career with New York Family Dentistry.


Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to make a difference – apply now and become a valued member of our team! And yes, our ideal candidate must be available to work every Saturday – because creating smiles knows no weekend breaks!

title: Dental Receptionist - Brooklyn Based
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional patient hospitality and making a positive impact on people's lives? New York Family Dentistry (NYFD) is excited to offer a unique opportunity for a Dental Receptionist to join our family-oriented team.


At NYFD, we prioritize creating lifelong positive experiences for our patients while fostering a supportive, engaging, and collaborative work environment.

**Why join us as a Dental Receptionist**

**Patient Hospitality:** Make a difference in patients' lives by providing a warm, welcoming, and positive experience from the moment they walk through our doors.

**Family Work Environment:** Be part of a close-knit team that values collaboration, support, and mutual respect.

**Competitive Compensation** Base per hour plus bonus opportunities.

**Career Growth**: Gain opportunities to grow your skills and advance your career in the dental field.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Warm Welcome:** Greet patients warmly and ensure they feel valued from their first interaction.

**Patient Support:** Assist patients in completing essential documentation, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

**Scheduling Excellence** Manage appointment scheduling, adapt to rescheduling or cancellations, and maintain an organized schedule for our dental team.

**Effective Communication**: Communicate professionally, respectfully, and courteously with patients and colleagues, embodying our esteemed practice's essence.

**Professional Appearance:** Maintain a neat and professional appearance, reflecting our company's positive image.


**What We Offer**

**Impactful Role:** Join a company transforming the field of dentistry, where your role will make a significant difference.

**Innovative Environment:** Thrive in an environment where cutting-edge technology is the norm and collaborate with industry experts to pioneer groundbreaking solutions.

**Career Development:** We are dedicated to nurturing your growth with tailored opportunities for advancement and learning.

**Team Spirit:** Enjoy the camaraderie of a dedicated team and partake in spirited quarterly meetings, where your expertise will be appreciated and celebrated.

**Requirements:**

  

* Previous Medical/Dental Reception experience, focusing on patient hospitality.
* Experience with Dental Office Software is a plus (Dentrix, Ascend, Eagle Soft)
* Knowledge of Dental terminology and procedures
* Knowledge of Dental Insurances; PPO, HMO, DHMO, Managed Care
* High School diploma or equivalent
* Fluent in English; Bilingual skills, proficiency in Spanish is preferred and considered a valuable asset.

  


Salary: starting at $18 per hour depending on experience


Join us at New York Family Dentistry and become part of a dynamic team that values your experience and offers opportunities for personal and professional growth. Apply now to embark on the next step in your career!

title: Orthodontic Assistant - Queens Based
description:
At NYFD, we are a trailblazing company at the forefront of dentistry. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work culture, encouraging fresh ideas and empowering our employees to achieve their full potential. As an orthodontic assistant you will play a pivotal role in driving our continued success. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the organizational workflow and work alongside a team of talented professionals who are dedicated to pushing boundaries and delivering exceptional results.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* taking their medical history, explaining the treatment process, and addressing any concerns or questions they may have.
* assist the orthodontist during procedures by providing instruments, materials, and equipment required for the treatment. They should also ensure the patient's comfort and safety throughout the procedure.
* taking dental X-rays and impressions of patients' teeth. They should be proficient in operating X-ray machines, following safety protocols, and ensuring accurate and clear images.
* should adhere to strict infection control protocols, sterilize instruments, clean treatment areas, and maintain a safe and hygienic working environment.
* should maintain patient records, update treatment progress notes, and document any necessary information related to the procedures performed.
* educate patients on proper oral hygiene practices, including brushing, flossing, and caring for their orthodontic appliances. They should also provide instructions on the use of orthodontic appliances and answer any questions related to treatment.

  


**Why Join New York Family Dentistry:**

**Meaningful Impact:** Be part of a company that is transforming dentistry.


**Innovative Environment:** Work with cutting-edge technology and collaborate with industry experts to drive groundbreaking solutions.


**Growth Opportunities:** We invest in our employees' professional development and provide ample opportunities for advancement and learning.


**Collaborative Culture:** Join a diverse, welcoming and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity, and open communication.

* Team celebrations and quarterly meetings

**Competitive Compensation and Benefits:** We offer a highly competitive salary package, comprehensive benefits, and additional perks to reward your hard work.️

* Salary: starting at $20-26 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday
  




**Requirements:**


To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and attributes:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* CPR or X Ray certification
* Completion of a dental assistant program or equivalent training
* Experience working in an orthodontic or dental office

title: Pediatric Dental Assistant - Brooklyn Based
description:
Are you passionate about providing quality dental care to children? Do you have a warm and friendly demeanor that puts young patients at ease? We have an exciting opportunity for a Pediatric Dental Assistant to join our dedicated team and make a positive impact on the oral health of our youngest patients.


At New York Family Dentistry, we are committed to delivering exceptional dental care in a comfortable and welcoming environment. Our team of professionals is dedicated to ensuring children have positive dental experiences, setting the foundation for a lifetime of good oral health.


As a Pediatric Dental Assistant, you will play a crucial role in providing support to our pediatric dentist and ensuring that each child's visit is smooth and enjoyable. Your responsibilities will include:

* Assisting the pediatric dentist during dental procedures, including examinations, cleanings, and treatments.
* Preparing treatment rooms and ensuring they are well-stocked and sanitized.
* Welcoming young patients and their families, helping to create a friendly and reassuring atmosphere.
* Educating children and their parents on proper oral hygiene techniques.
* Taking digital X-rays and maintaining accurate patient records.
* Sterilizing and maintaining dental instruments and equipment.
* Providing chairside assistance to the dentist, anticipating their needs and ensuring patient comfort.
* Offering support to children who may be anxious or nervous about dental procedures.
* Adhering to infection control protocols and maintaining a safe environment for patients and staff.
* Participating in team meetings and continuing education opportunities to stay up-to-date with best practices.

  


**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of an accredited dental assisting program.
* Pediatric dental experience is preferred but not required; willingness to learn and work with children is essential.
* X-ray certification.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially when interacting with children and parents.
* Organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.

  


**Benefits:** We offer a competitive compensation package along with the following benefits:

* Salary: starting at $20 per hour depending on experience
* Benefits Package Available
* Convenient 4 Day Week Schedule giving you 3 days off to do what you love!
	+ Wednesday-Saturday
	+ Sunday-Wednesday
